question.body: Which of the following is a correct statement?

multiple_choice.choice: Only covalent bonds lead to molecules that are stable in air.
Only ionic bonds lead to molecules that are stable in air.
Ionic bonds do not share valence electrons while covalent bonds do.
Covalent bonds only occur between atoms of similar electronegativies while ionic bonds only occur between atoms of differing electronegativities.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Ionic bonds can also be stable in air, such as table salt.
Incorrect. Covalent bonds can also be stable in air, such as glucose.
Correct. Ionic bonding involves a complete transfer of one electron to another, so that sharing is not occurring. Covalent bonds do share valence electrons.
Incorrect. Although ionic bonds occur between atoms of differing electronegativities, covalent bonds can occur between atoms of similar, or differing, electronegativities.
